question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. <katex>$r_1=20$</katex> cm, <katex>$I_1=4 \text{ kg m}^2$</katex>, <katex>$r_2=30$</katex> cm, <katex>$I_2=20 \text{ kg m}^2$</katex>. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/q6_data.png
explanation: For smaller wheel: <katex>$\tau_1 = I_1 \alpha_1 \implies 10 = 4\alpha_1 \implies \alpha_1 = 2.5 = 5/2$</katex> rad/s<katex>^2</katex>. (Matches iii)
Tangential acceleration is same: <katex>$r_1 \alpha_1 = r_2 \alpha_2 \implies 0.2(2.5) = 0.3\alpha_2 \implies 0.5 = 0.3\alpha_2 \implies \alpha_2 = 5/3$</katex>. (Matches i)
Torque on larger wheel: <katex>$\tau_2 = I_2 \alpha_2 = 20(5/3) = 100/3$</katex> Nm. (Matches ii)
